# Here are three plots
## First, load necessary packages:
```{r}
library(p8105.datasets)
library(flexdashboard)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(rnoaa)
```
## Importing and cleaning the dataset:
```{r}
data(ny_noaa)

set.seed(123) # I randomly choose 1000 lines because the dataset is too large
ny_noaa <- ny_noaa %>%
  sample_n(1000)

ny_noaa <- ny_noaa %>%
  filter(!is.na(prcp), !is.na(snow), !is.na(tmax), !is.na(tmin))
```

## Scatter Plot (Date and Snowfall)
```{r}
ny_noaa$date <- as.Date(ny_noaa$date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

plot_ly(ny_noaa, x = ~date, y = ~snow, type = "scatter", mode = "markers") %>%
  layout(title = "Date vs. Snowfall",
         xaxis = list(title = "Date"),
         yaxis = list(title = "Snowfall (snow)"))
```

## Barchart (Date and Precipitation)
```{r}
agg_data <- aggregate(ny_noaa$prcp ~ format(as.Date(ny_noaa$date, format="%Y-%m-%d"), "%Y"), FUN=sum)

plot_ly(agg_data, labels = ~format(as.Date(ny_noaa$date, format="%Y-%m-%d"), "%Y"), values = ~ny_noaa$prcp, type = 'pie') %>%
  layout(title = 'Total Precipitation per Year')
```

## Bar Chart (tmax and tmin)
```{r}
plot_ly(data = ny_noaa, x = ~tmax, y = ~tmin, type = 'bar', colors = 'viridis') %>%
  layout(title = "Bar Chart of Dates", xaxis = list(title = "tmax"), yaxis = list(title = "Count"))
```
